item.description: ssh portfowarding If you have SSH access to a remote system and want to access the internet through that system on your local machine, you can set up SSH tunneling or port forwarding to achieve this. Here’s a step-by-step guide: Open a terminal or command prompt on your local system. Establish an SSH connection to the remote system using the following command: ssh -D <local_port_number> <username>@<remote_system_address> Replace <local_port_number> with a port number of your choice (e.
